messages: 91c41d1ff5a97ecc17345e7bc0d4f9df (01:34): lol, wow just saw the whole "oriental" conversation above. nice.

91c41d1ff5a97ecc17345e7bc0d4f9df (01:38): 47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec: hey, Divya, I was just poking around through the mark up on your site (looks great btw). I noticed you're using HTML5 Shim... I was think about using it on a new site. How do you like it so far?
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (01:38): oh my site is like relly old
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (01:39): its okay i suppose, but if you are also using modernizr you dont need to 91c41d1ff5a97ecc17345e7bc0d4f9df
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (01:40): we're releasing an update to the shim soon

91c41d1ff5a97ecc17345e7bc0d4f9df (01:41): 47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec: yeah, I use HTML5Boilerplate for everything these days, but I don't always end up using Modernizr. Just wondering if Remy's shim was a viable option if I just need to enable some HTML5 tags...
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (01:42): which is the same as the html5 shiv which is the same as the IEPP which is whats in modernizr
91c41d1ff5a97ecc17345e7bc0d4f9df (01:43): I love it when "the" is in quotes... cause you KNOW its bad ass
91c41d1ff5a97ecc17345e7bc0d4f9df (01:49): 47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec: whats the sigh for on that article? agree? disagree?
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (01:50): sigh coz it claims you "HAVE TO" have a heading for a sectioning element
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (01:52): and sez avoid using sectioning elements?!
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (01:53): its way too pedantic, which is why I sigh
91c41d1ff5a97ecc17345e7bc0d4f9df (01:54): lol, going to be honest: I just asked my wife, and neither of us knew the correct definition of "pedantic"
91c41d1ff5a97ecc17345e7bc0d4f9df (01:54): I looked it up and the NBC "The More You Know" shooting star just flew over my head
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (01:55): "overly concerned with minute details or formalisms"
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (01:56): <input type="file" accept="image/*;capture=camera" />  .. device orientation .. and 3d transforms!!

91c41d1ff5a97ecc17345e7bc0d4f9df (02:01): Riddle me this HTML5 friends: do class names and IDs on elements have "semantic value"... in other words, is it problematic to have class="container_12 push_8 grid_4" versus something more clear like class="navigation" ? I've seen devs argue strongly in either direction.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (02:10): 91c41d1ff5a97ecc17345e7bc0d4f9df: user agents are specifically instructed to ignore classes and ids for semantic purposes
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (02:12): finally found somebody who actually uses opera :D
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (02:13): have not used much of it, but its not bad, you would have been hounded if it was bad :P
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (02:14): i will ping you if I find anything screwy
47e6a4aabaebc333d88ea9d2feb1e8ec (02:14): but mostly have not come across any yet.
